name: HD 12648
scenarioDescription:
The HD 12648 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 12648 is a star with 0.67 times the mass of the Sun, and 11.02 times its radius. It is located 597.35 light years away from the solar system.

HD 12648 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 12648 system


HD 12648 b

HD 12648 b was discovered by the Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.54 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 12648 b is 623.28 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 12648 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 12648, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory.
